a.title: Coronavirus (COVID-19) Information and Resources
a.span: Stay informed: Coronavirus (COVID-19) information and resources

a.title: Continuous Learning Opportunities for Parents & Students

h4.a: Continuous Learning Opportunities for Parents & Students

em.strong: For information in languages other than English, please contact your child's office.

a.title: Count Me In 2020: Ellenville CSD NEEDS you to be counted

img.alt: Count Me In 2020: Ellenville CSD NEEDS you to be counted
This is the image for the news article titled April 23, 2020: School Closure Update

div.div: Today, Thursday, April 23, we were notified that we have an essential staff member who has tested positive for novel coronavirus (COVID-19), and two other essential staff members who are undergoing testing. Out of an abundance of caution, the buildings, which have only been open for essential services, will now be completely closed for the next two weeks to allow time to thoroughly clean and sanitize. Staff will continue to work remotely and will be checking emails regularly. Distance learning will continue and all food deliveries will resume as scheduled. If you have any questions, please contact your main office. In closing, please continue to be safe. Each individual plays an important role in preventing the spread of this illness.
div.a: Read More about April 23, 2020: School Closure Update

img.alt: This is the image for the news article titled Emergency Child Care

div.div: The YMCA of Kingston and Ulster County is providing emergency child care for healthcare workers and other essential personnel at Ellenville Elementary School, Monday through Friday, from 8 AM to 4 PM. The program is for children ages 5 - 12 and the drop-in rate is $20. For more information, or to register, call 338-3810, ext. 110 or visit www.ymcaulster.org/emergency-child-care.
div.a: Read More about Emergency Child Care

img.alt: This is the image for the news article titled Elementary Summer BOOST Academy

div.div: Dear Parent or Guardian: I am pleased to inform you that Ellenville Elementary School will once again be providing summer learning support through our Summer Boost Academy. If you choose to have your child participate, they will be part of an exciting summer educational opportunity. The program will be under the direction of Ulster BOCES and held in the Ellenville Elementary School. The goal of the program is to give your child a “BOOST” in their academic achievement by specifically strengthening your child’s grade level reading, writing, and math skills.In order to ensure that we have a space for your child, we are asking that you respond by Friday, May 15th. You can register your child for the program by completing the Permission Form on the District Webpage/Facebook or complete the attached Form, and send it back to the elementary school.
div.a: Read More about Elementary Summer BOOST Academy

img.alt: This is the image for the news article titled Ellenville High School: Attention Students & Parents

a.title: Ellenville High School: Attention Students & Parents

div.a: Ellenville High School: Attention Students & Parents
div.div: We miss you and hope you are well. In the coming days, you will be receiving a packet in the mail with additional assignments for the month of April. Please make sure you are checking in with your teachers on Google Classroom and your school email account for more information on these assignments. Additionally, you may be receiving an increase in phone calls with a restricted or unknown phone number. Teachers and counselors have been placing phone calls through Google Hangouts which does block the incoming phone number. Please get in the habit of answering these calls, if possible. Also, if you have not already done so, please check your student email to complete the elective course preferences form for next school year. Lastly, be on the lookout for our high school student newsletter named "It's Monday" and an invitation to the Ellenville High School Google Classroom.
div.a: Read More about Ellenville High School: Attention Students & Parents

img.alt: This is the image for the news article titled Count Me In: The 2020 Census Starts Soon

a.title: Count Me In: The 2020 Census Starts Soon

div.a: Count Me In: The 2020 Census Starts Soon
div.div: The U.S. Census Bureau has mailed out invitations to households across the country to complete a 10-question census form. The census is completed every 10 years and its data is used in a variety of ways, from determining how many members of Congress a state will get to how billions of dollars of federal funds will be spent. The Ellenville Central School District is encouraging all residents to participate in this national headcount, which directly benefits funding available to the school district and local community.
div.a: Read More about Count Me In: The 2020 Census Starts Soon

div.p: The Ellenville Central School District endeavors to be a school community in which all children learn, achieve and exceed the competencies outlined in the New York State Learning Standards as prescribed by the Board of Regents and the Board of Education. It is our expectation that all children and adults excel in their talents, gifts and abilities.
